page.title: 20CALDECOTE BRIDLEPATHS
page.content: BRIDLEPATH TO BOURN. THIS IS A WIDE TRACK WHICH DURING THE WINTER CAN BE VERY MUDDY AS IT IS USED BY TRACTORS. THE FIRST PART IS ALONGSIDE A PLOUGHED FIELD, THEN AFTER A SHARP LEFT AND THEN RIGHT HAND TURN THE PATH RUNS BETWEEN TALL HEDGES. IT SLOWLYDIPS DOWN TOWARDS A CULVERT AND THEN RISES AGAIN AND THE HEDGES DISAPPEAR. AT THIS POINT THERE ARE MAGNIFICENT VIEWS TOWARDS BOURN AND KINGSTON. THE PATH THEN DIPS DOWN AGAIN TO THE SEWAGE PUMPING STATION AND AT THIS POINT BECOMES A CONCRETE ROAD. IT THEN RISES AGAIN UNTIL IT REACHES BOURN. {PHOTOGRAPH D}IS AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS BRIDLEWAY. THESE NOTES ARE MADE BY JANET JOHNSON, CLERK TO PARISH COUNCIL, AND CAN BE SEEN WITH DOGS ON PHOTOGRAPH D.
